Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
busiest music bird and it's time for a
review of the new cola album moody cute
Cola is the musical project of
electronic tinkerer and extreme sampler
Michael this is his new full-length
under this name with which he has
released other following albums which
not too much unlike this one our
electronic sample based and have a sort
of neo psychedelic tone to them I would
actually say an earlier releases like
dial tone Earth there was a really clear
Animal Collective influence in how some
of the samples were executed there were
even some really strong dub reggae vibes
which continued very strongly on his
next full-length daydream repeater that
dropped in late 2011 moody coupe though
if you're familiar with colas earlier
stuff still very much feels like a Cola
release mostly because of these Spacey's
synths and the way that vocal samples
and just samples in general are chopped
on this thing but surely this album
comes off as being much more abstract
and complex on this thing Cola grabs
samples from across the conceptual plain
everything from scissors cutting to
drink sipping spans of music pieces of
percussion weird unidentifiable noises
breaths a lot of familiar sounds that
are executed in such a strange way that
I feel like I've just transported into
this completely different world where
nothing makes sense it's like an
electronically generated Dali painting
or something my records behind me are
melting and kouchuu chest is playing
them a lot of CO solo on a dog
it is difficult to make sense ibisworld
acting the rhythms throughout this album
are incredibly cheery and and strange
very oddly shaped and the samples are
twisted pitch shifted manipulated in a
myriad of different ways the
synthesizers feel as if they're playing
sequences that were programmed on some
computer from the late 90s early 2000s
they kind of have a tone to them that
feel as if they were borrowed from like
a self-help video or something it's kind
of vaporwave if you ask me there's
definitely an element of plunder phonics
on this album
I'll OneNote Rick's point never or Matt
mos there's some glitchy music sampling
abstractions on this thing too that
remind me of Early Girl Talk and many of
the samples on this record are pasted
out in a way that feels as if they're
spelling out some kind of experimental
techno structure that I can't quite make
sense of even though there are artists
in sample-based music that I can't point
to in reference to this album this LP
feels more like a personal exploration
of sound and music as opposed to some
kind of ode to anyone influenced even
though this album can be very
disorienting at first because of its
sounds once I listen to it again and
again and again I really kind of got a
feel what each track was going for
stylistically
and emotionally and it just wasn't this
very confusing jumble
for example the opening track on this
thing sukiyaki to die for which in a way
really has a strong jazz fusion vibe to
it with its constant ride cymbals the
piano and since on this thing too but of
course the samples in just the the very
Spacey production the reverb production
makes it feel pretty futuristic and sort
of Cosmo grama Flying Lotus esque it's a
pretty intricate track that I dig a lot
and the song deaf Christian is is
another favorite of mine from this LP
the track has a really busy beat and it
feels as if it's sampling these Motown
era vocals the words that are being sung
and the melodies really ring true from
this era of music but the way that this
song builds
especially with the hi-hats on this
thing it feels as if it's also borrowing
from trap music to the track is really
an incredible and creative set of
influences samples and edits and there's
a hard groove on this track too
even though many of the sounds on this
album may seem strange with how they're
placed and where they're coming from
Cola is typically not mysterious when it
comes to grooves the grooves that these
beats rock are really the most
straightforward thing about this album
in my opinion if there is a major
downside that some listeners may find on
this LP though it's that the constant
and strange samples being repeated over
and over and over on many of these
tracks can be a little overbearing and
the sounds that Cola assembles on some
of these tracks most notably on a track
like melters Delight it's not like all
the sounds in my opinion really come
together into something that feels
cohesive with all the synth arpeggios on
the song really clashing more than they
come together really makes this song
more of a mess than a triumph I can see
that the hi-hat really references kind
of a techno thing on this song but
kholat definitely makes it experimental
by omitting the constant kick drum but I
still feel like this track and many
others on here don't go on for as long
as they possibly could maybe string
these ideas out a little bit make some
space and build up to the most intense
and really kick off in this part instead
songs like melters delight really make a
ruckus and and bow out pretty quickly I
pretty much feel the same way about the
track redeemable features songs like
unfor example really take their time
going somewhere set a very patient pace
I love the woodwinds sense on this track
which are matched up with other synth
tones as well which are equally lush
that combined with some of the weird
clicks and hi-hats and the beat on this
thing this song is much more palatable
the song suspicious kind of has that dub
reggae feel creeping back into colas
music it has these guitar samples that
really it skips across the ocean like
rocks and on top of it the song takes
these chill though khals and sax samples
that are warped in this very strange way
that's sort of unsettling and sour this
album to me is really more of an
experimental mind game and
while it is really intriguing it is very
playful that can't be denied either to
listen to these songs over and over and
over again the novelty of just how weird
and out there they are wears off
moderately quick and the fact they don't
have a really strong structure to them
it does make this album lose its flavor
